column2: In two of these sentences, needn't have doesn't make sense. Which two?
column3: I needn't have gone out, so I stayed at home all day. {{c1::not OK}}

column2: In two of these sentences, needn't have doesn't make sense. Which two?
column3: You needn't have bought eggs. We already had some. Now we have too many. {{c1::OK}}

column2: In two of these sentences, needn't have doesn't make sense. Which two?
column3: We thought there would be problems, but we needn't have worried. Everything was fine. {{c1::OK}}

column2: In two of these sentences, needn't have doesn't make sense. Which two?
column3: I expected it to be cold, so I wore my coat. I needn't have worn it â€“ it wasn't cold at all. {{c1::OK}}

column2: In two of these sentences, needn't have doesn't make sense. Which two?
column3: I needn't have said anything, so I kept quiet. {{c1::not OK}}

column2: In two of these sentences, needn't have doesn't make sense. Which two?
column3: I needn't have said anything. I wish I'd kept quiet. {{c1::OK}}
